title: 112_s3309
content: The "Homeless Veterans Assistance Improvement Act of 2012" is the short title of this Act. The table of contents for this Act is provided. Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents. Requirement for grants from Department of Veterans Affairs to meet physical privacy, safety, and security needs of homeless veterans. Modification of authority for capital improvement grants. Funding for legal services for low-income veteran families. Changes to per diem payment requirements for services to homeless veterans. Authorization of grants by Department of Veterans Affairs. Sec. 6 authorizes grants from the Department of Veterans Affairs to centers serving homeless veterans for operational expenses. Sec. 7 expands the VA's authority to provide dental care to homeless veterans. Sec. 8 extends programs for homeless veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs is amending requirements for grants to comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans to ensure physical privacy, safety, and security needs are met. Additionally, the authority to provide capital improvement grants for these programs is being modified to include maintenance. The Department of Veterans Affairs is amending requirements for grants to comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans to ensure physical privacy, safety, and security needs are met. Funding is also allocated for legal services to very low-income veteran families in permanent housing, with a minimum of one percent designated for specific services. Additionally, modifications are made to per diem payments for services provided to homeless veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs is amending requirements for grants to comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans to ensure physical privacy, safety, and security needs are met. Funding is allocated for legal services to very low-income veteran families in permanent housing, with modifications made to per diem payments for services provided to homeless veterans, including care for dependents of homeless veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must create regulations within one year to implement the changes for grants to homeless veteran service programs. Authorization of grants by the Department of Veterans Affairs to centers providing services to homeless veterans for operational expenses. The Department of Veterans Affairs may award grants for operational expenses to service centers for homeless veterans, with a limit of $500,000 per fiscal year. The Department of Veterans Affairs will issue regulations for service center operational grants under section 2012A of title 38, United States Code. Additionally, the Department's authority to provide dental care to homeless veterans will be expanded. Section 2062 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to extend eligibility for care to veterans enrolled under section 1705(a) receiving assistance under section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 or care in specified settings for 60 consecutive days. The Secretary may provide funds for a grant and per diem provider in a specified setting for veterans who have received assistance or care for 60 consecutive days, disregarding breaks in continuity for which the veteran is not responsible. SEC. 8. EXTENSIONS OF AUTHORITIES AND PROGRAMS AFFECTING HOMELESS VETERANS. Section 2013 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to allocate $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2013 and $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2014 onwards. Various programs related to homeless veterans are extended until December 31, 2014, to provide outreach, care, treatment, rehabilitation, and transitional housing for veterans with serious mental illness. Various programs related to homeless veterans are extended until December 31, 2014, with amendments to specific sections of the title to provide financial assistance and support services for very low-income veteran families in permanent housing.
